name: surface_radioactivity_content_of_226Ra
description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Radioactivity" means the number of radioactive decays of a material per second. "Ra" means the element "radium" and "226Ra" is the isotope "radium-226" with a half-life of 5.86e+05 days.
